lead_paragraph: A California state law aimed at seizing the money and property of major drug dealers is increasingly taking assets from people who can ill-afford to defend themselves, a newspaper says. The San Jose Mercury News reported this week that while leaders of drug rings had learned to fend off forfeitures with lawyers and accountants, the poor, those who speak little English and those who are casual drug users most often had their money and property seized by the authorities in drug-related arrests.

headline.main: Inequity Seen in Drug Forfeiture Law
